page.title: 14Farming (4)
page.content:
{Bickmarsh Lodge Farm}is situated alongside the old Roman Road which is known as Ickneild Street, Ryknild Street or Buckle Street. The farm consists of three hundred and twenty acres which are under Winter Barley and Corn. The produce is sold directly to a corn merchant.
{Ullington Hall Farm}comprises three hundred and twenty one acres, rearing three hundred ewes, eight rams, and fifty head of cattle. The farm also produces cereals which are sold to private firms locally. The live stock is auctioned at Banbury Market. The farm is managed by the owners with the help of a young apprentice. On the farm there is the site of an old chapel and records show that this chapel once belonged to the diocese of Gloucester.
